subject: HMNG
name: Intro to Hmong Language I
info: Foundations of learning Hmong. Speaking, reading, writing, listening. Communication/interaction, supplemented with grammatical details. Hmong community/culture.

subject: HMNG
name: Intro to Hmong Language II
info:
Continuation of 1001. Foundations of learning Hmong. Speaking, reading, writing, listening. Communication/interaction, supplemented with grammatical details. Hmong community/culture.

prereq: 1001 or 1011

subject: HMNG
name: Beginning Hmong I
info: Listening, speaking, reading, writing skills. Emphasizes development of communicative competence.

subject: HMNG
name: Beginning Hmong II
info:
Continuation of 1011. Listening, speaking, reading, writing skills. Development of communicative competence.

prereq: HMNG 1001 or 1011

subject: HMNG
name: Medical Hmong
info:
This online course is designed for students and working professionals interested in learning the Hmong language in relation to the medical field, including but not limited to:
1. General phrases of greetings and introductions used in interpersonal settings.
2. Conversational Hmong, geared towards medical topics.
3. Medical terminology and cultural expressions relating to health and culture.
No prior Hmong language background is required and there are no course prerequisites.
While effective communication is essential in all fields of work, it is especially vital in the medical field. This online medical Hmong language course provides opportunities for students to learn and understand Hmong. Emphasis will be on key phrases, vocabulary, and cultural nuances related to the medical field. The course will provide a foundation for speaking, reading, writing, and listening comprehension for individuals interested in working with Hmong-speaking patients, clients, and others in the medical field. Students will have opportunities to learn and apply materials to real-world case scenarios and situations in the medical field.

subject: HMNG
name: Accelerated Beginning Hmong
info:
Review of grammar/usage, practice in reading/writing. Introduction to Hmong literature and formal writing. Topics in Hmong culture.

prereq: Ability in basic spoken Hmong

subject: HMNG
name: Accelerated Intermediate Hmong
info:
Review of grammar/usage, continued practice in reading/writing. Expanded introduction to Hmong literature/formal writing. Selected topics in Hmong culture.

prereq: [1011 and 1012] or 1015 or instr consent

subject: HMNG
name: Intermediate Hmong I
info:
Listening, speaking, reading, writing. Grammar review/elaboration. Authentic texts, cultural readings, basic compositions, oral presentations.

prereq: Hmng 1002 or Hmng 1012 or Hmng 1015

subject: HMNG
name: Intermediate Hmong II
info:
Continuation of 3021. Listening, speaking, reading, writing. Grammar review/elaboration. Authentic texts, cultural readings, basic compositions, oral presentations.

prereq: Hmng 3021

subject: HMNG
name: Advanced Hmong I
info:
Speaking, listening, reading, writing. Complex vocabularies, sentence structures from Hmong newspapers, magazine, folktales, folk songs, novels, poetry, proverbs, riddles. Concepts/terms from social/ritual settings. Idioms, slang, classifiers.

prereq: 3022 or equiv or instr consent

subject: HMNG
name: Advanced Hmong II
info:
Speaking, listening, reading, writing. Complex vocabularies, sentence structures from Hmong newspapers, magazine, folktales, folk songs, novels, poetry, proverbs, riddles. Concepts /terms from social/ritual settings. Idioms, slang, classifiers.

prereq: 3031 or equiv or instr consent

subject: HMNG
name: Hmong Teaching Tutorial
info:
Students tutor beginning students of Hmong and are part of department's Hmong language team.

prereq: Grade of A in 3022

subject: HMNG
name: Topics in Hmong Literature
info: Topics specified in Course Schedule.

subject: HMNG
name: Directed Studies
info:
Guided individual study of Hmong language or linguistics.

prereq: instr consent, dept consent, college consent

subject: HMNG
name: Readings in Hmong Texts
info: Comprehensive, multidimensional overview of Hmong oral forms/traditions. Hmong legends, mythology, folksongs, birth, marriage/funeral rites. History, social/cultural anthropology. Values, life ways of traditional village society. Societal changes resulting from emigration to U.S.

subject: HMNG
name: Hmong Social & Cultural Exprnc
fullname: Readings in Hmong Social and Cultural Experience
info:
Students read a variety of authentic texts in Hmong, ranging from traditional folklore, folksongs, stories, research, news articles, and more. Utilizing these authentic texts, students will have in-depth discussions on Hmong literature, vocabulary, language applications and social/cultural structures. In-class discussions focus on language use, social interpretations of texts, and social applications. Class is conducted 80% Hmong, and 20% English.

prereq: HMNG 3031 or instructor consent

subject: HMNG
name: Directed Studies
info:
Guided individual study of Hmong language or linguistics.

prereq: instr consent, dept consent, college consent
